results.title: Ask an Australian about still water swimming [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Peter Lake and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: At a family picnic by a river, a father explains to his young son the dangers of swimming in still water. The film then shows the rescue methods relevant to swimming pools, rivers and calm beaches. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Ask an Australian about driving [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Shows various driving conditions that may be encountered in Australia. The demands of both city and country driving are dealt with. Different traffic regulations in each state are explained, with an emphasis on the need to obey traffic signs and laws. Shows how to set about buying a car. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Building a bridge: Tajik
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how, in three days of actual construction, one hundred Tajik men and boys from one village work together to rebuild their hand-construction bridge. No narration.

results.title: Pierre et Paul = Pierre and Paul
results.creator_credit: Rene Allio, Yves Robert and Leon Carre
results.brief_description:
Pierre, a middle manager in a building company, decides to buy a appartment and live with his girlfriend, Martine. But, the subsequent death of his father and various financial difficulties soon damage his mental equilibrium. When the May ‘68 riots errupt, Pierre goes off the rails.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre, Yves Robert ; director, Rene Allio ; writer, Rene Allio ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Jacques Dutronc.
Cast: Pierre Mondy, Robert Juillard, Bulle Ogier, Madeleine Barbulee, Helene Vincent.

results.title: Mwansa the Great
results.creator_credit: Rungano Nyoni, Gabriel Gauchet, ICreateFilms and UK Film Council
results.brief_description: A little boy sees himself as ‘Mwansa the great’, a full-grown warrior hunting lions. His little sister also visualises herself as an adult, ‘Princess Shula’ who is responsible for disciplining and looking after Mwansa.

results.title: Mapping a city of fragments v.2
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Using the opening of Godard’s film ‘Alphaville’ as a foundation, Lord constructs a vision of the evolving global city during the last years of the 20th Century. Structured as a series of repetitions, the montage of the changing city is offset by shots of Silicon Valley corporate facades. The result is a dialectical contrast between urban and suburban space, body and mind, chaos and order, and the post-modern and the modern. Shot in Hi-8 video in Tokyo, Fukuoka City, Mexico City, Rome, San Francisco, Naples and Los Angeles.

results.title: Giron: bay of pigs
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC), Humberto Hernandez, Orlando de la Huertes and Manuel Herrera
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary account of the failed CIA-sponsored assault at the Bay of Pigs in April, 1961. The operation subsequently created serious embarrassment for the U.S. government and led to wide-ranging political repercussions. Employing interviews with participants in the original events, re-enactments of the fighting and actual documentary footage of the assault, the film reconstructs the entire event, from the first air raid strikes to the retaking of Playa Giron by the revolutionary troops. Dramatised and documentary sequences are seamlessly blended to provide a dramatically compelling war narrative. Made with the participation of the Revolutionary Armed Forces.
